properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will gradually come to an end over eastern portions of mainland Nova Scotia after midnight, and early Wednesday morning over Cape Breton. Total rainfall amounts of 25 and 50 mm are expected. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-24T08:59:05-00:00

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and ice pellets with a risk of freezing rain expected tonight and Wednesday. A second shot of winter weather on Thursday and Friday. A mixture of ice pellets, snow, and occasional freezing rain is expected tonight and Wednesday. Although amounts may not be enough to require a warning, travel will still be hazardous in these areas. Please consider postponing non-essential travel. Another storm is forecast to affect Newfoundland on Thursday and early Friday. This feature is expected to track a little further south than tonight's system. It appears significant snowfall is possible for parts of the West Coast, the Northeast Coast, the East Coast as well as central Newfoundland. Warnings will likely be required for the Thursday/Friday event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-24T09:05:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T01:06:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0759350335.2019
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bonavista Peninsula, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A mixture of ice pellets, snow, and occasional freezing rain is expected today. Total accumulation of 5 to 10 cm of ice pellets are forecast before the ice pellets taper off this evening. Travel will be hazardous in these areas. Please consider postponing non-essential travel. Another storm is forecast to affect Newfoundland on Thursday and early Friday. Snow will redevelop midday on Thursday and persist until Friday morning. Significant snowfall amounts are possible and warnings will likely be required for the this event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-25T01:52:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T07:33:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3176088510.2019
Area: Bonavista Peninsula, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continues For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-04-24T09:30:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-04-23T09:43:18-05:00, C7B639DD-8506-8A23-4971-663CA08A4036
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong wind gusts are expected or occurring Strong easterly winds in the Wreckhouse area will further increase to 140 km/h early this morning. Winds are expected to diminish to 90 km/h later this morning and weaken significantly this afternoon. These strong easterly winds are forecast to redevelop tonight in the Wreckhouse area. Winds gusting to 110 km/h will develop overnight and further increase to 140 km/h by Thursday morning. Winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria late in the day on Thursday. ### Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at risk of being overturned. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-24T23:32:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T07:33:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4090575228.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: We expect higher than normal water levels near the coast this morning. Coastal flood warning issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec Region on 2019-04-24. A low pressure system from the Great Lakes will bring moderate to strong winds over the Quebec City area Wednesday morning. These winds combined with the high flow of the St Lawrence River and the current run of high-amplitude tidal ranges could strongly produce flooding along the entire coast in and around the following localities, on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern Daylight Time). Note that the flooding in question may be more significant that what we observed during the last few days. Quebec City: 2019-04-24, from 09:00 AM to 12:00 PM. ### Coastal flooding is possible along the shoreline. Storm surge warnings are issued when water levels pose a threat to coastal regions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-24T17:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T03:45:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2806024110.2019
Area: Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Light snow will become heavy at times this morning. Snow will mix with ice pellets this afternoon. Total accumulations of 15 to 20 cm are forecast before the snow tapers off late this afternoon or early this evening. Conditions will improve tonight but are expected to deteriorate again on Thursday as another storm approaches Newfoundland. It will bring a second round of snow from Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. Significant snowfall amounts are possible and warnings will likely be continued for the this event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-24T23:30:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T07:31:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2477995306.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Extended period of significant freezing rain today. Freezing rain and ice pellets will persist into this evening. Significant ice build up is expected. Conditions will improve tonight but are expected to deteriorate again on Thursday as another storm approaches Newfoundland. It will bring snow from Thursday morning through Friday morning. Significant snowfall amounts are possible and warnings will likely be required for the this event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-24T16:31:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T07:32:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0868861743.2019

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A deep low pressure system continues to influence the Yukon. A strong pressure gradient will cause very strong winds of 80 km/h gusting to 100 near the Richardson Mountains. Combined with light snow, these winds will cause extensive blowing snow and reduce visibility to near zero. These blizzard conditions will persist through to Wednesday evening. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-24T14:35:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-23T22:36:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1620152543.2019
Area: Dempster

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds gusting to 100 km/h are expected early this morning in areas prone to enhanced, downslope winds. Winds will begin to diminish later this morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain is expected or occurring. Periods of freezing rain developing overnight. The freezing rain will change over to snow on Wednesday morning as the system tracks into Hudson Bay. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
